H0.text: A pulley redirects force so that turgor pressure in plant root cells can crack the rocks in which they grow.

H1.text: A wedge redirects force so that turgor pressure in the cells of plant roots can eventually crack the rocks in which they grow.

H2.text: An inclined plane redirects the force of turgor pressure in plant root cells, which is strong enough to eventually crack the rocks in which they grow.

H3.text: A wheel and axle is the machine that redirects force in a manner analogous to turgor pressure in plant root cells, which can eventually crack the rocks in which the roots grow.
